content.description: The crux is the upper half. Climb easily up to double sidepulls, left hand on a rounded one on the arete. Now figure out how to get to and use the pockets on the upper face, the only one that is really any good is the lower right one. As an added bonus the top is nice and rounded so not going out of control for the lip as a bail out. This is actually one of the harder top outs on the boulder and the landing as it is now is not very forgiving.
content.protection:
Pads and spotter. 

  If someone actually cuts the stump down even with the ground the landing would be greatly improved.
content.location: The NW arete climbed from the right. Above a poorly cut down tree that leaves a terrible stump in the middle of the landing area.

content.description: Low, low sit start on a horizontal rail to a couple of shallow pockets. Tough move to gain the lip. Kick the right foot up and start mantling onto the slab, press it out on your left arm using intermediates for your right hand untill you can make a desperate snatch at the top of the boulder, or crush two very small crimps and gain the top that way.
content.location: 6' right of Liar, Liar starting on a rail 2' off the ground.

content.description:
The first move is the hardest, but the top out provides a bit of entertainment as well. Could be a shoulder wrecker if you are already experiencing and problems there. Look for a knob to help with topping out. 

  The SDS makes the problem V6 or V7
content.location: The vertical seam/crack on the north side of the boulder, up the middle of the face.

content.description: Standing start off of a high 3 finger right hand sidepull and a terrible left hold to gain some opposition. Pull onto the wall with difficulty and slap up with the left eventually gaining a shallow 3 finger crimp/pocket. Move up and right past a sloper and a small knob to a big pocket. Then straight up and back left to a pocket in the slab to top out.
content.location: The small arete that ends 8-10' up, right of center on the north face of the boulder, before the trees start crowding in.

content.description: Sit/crouch start, left hand in a low hueco and right on a good crimp on the horizontal rail. Use heel hooks to make moves up the arete on left facing holds culminating in a long reach for a good 2 handed edge. A few more moves on better holds and sharp texture on the top of the boulder take you to the top.
content.location: The left arete of the north face of the boulder starting from a low start.

content.description: Majority of the problems are on the north side of this boulder. A couple problems exist on the jigsaw looking west face and the down climb is on the south side going down to a tree. Problems from V2 or 3 to V9 are done and multiple project exist.
